title: Go, Labor On; Spend, And Be Spent
author: Horatius Bonar (1808-1889)
presentation: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7

v1: Go, labor on; spend, and be spent;
Thy joy to do the Father's will;
It is the way the Master went;
Should not the servant tread it still?
v2: Go, labor on: 'tis not for nought;
Thine earthly loss is heav'nly gain;
Men heed thee, love thee, praise thee not;
The Master praises, what are men?
v3: Go, labor on; your hands are weak,
Your knees are faint, your soul cast down;
Yet falter not; the prize you seek
Is near, a kingdom and a crown.
v4: Go, labor on while it is day,
The world's dark night is hastening on;
Speed, speed thy work, cast sloth away,
It is not thus that souls are won.
v5: Men die in darkness at your side,
Without a hope to cheer the tomb;
Take up the torch and wave it wide,
The torch that lights time's thickest gloom.
v6: Press on, faint not, keep watch and pray;
Be wise the erring soul to win;
Go forth into the world's highway,
Compel the wanderer to come in.
v7: Press on, and in thy work rejoice;
For work comes rest, the prize thus won;
Soon shalt thou hear the Master's voice,
The midnight cry, Behold, I come!
